gurmukhi: ੲਿੱਕ ੲਿੱਕ ਲੈ ਚਲੈ ੲਿੱਕ ਤਨ ੲਿੱਕ ਅਰੁੱਝੈ ॥
transliteration: Ikk Ikk Lai Chalai Ikk Tan Ikk Arujjhai||
translation: The warriors came forward after one another and began to fight one to one.

gurmukhi: ਅੰਧ ਧੁੰਧ ਪਰ ਗੲੀ ਹੱਥਿ ਅਰ ਮੁੱਖ ਨ ਸੁੱਝੈ ॥
transliteration: Andh Dhoundh Par Gadhatth(i) Ar Moukkh Na Sujjhai||
translation: There was such a terrible destruction that nothing could be recognized,

gurmukhi: ਸੁਮੁਹੇ ਸੂਰ ਸਾਵੰਤ ਸਭ ਫੳੁਜ ਰਾਜ ਅੰਗਦ ਸਮਰ ॥
transliteration: Soumuhe Soor Saavnt Sabh Phauj Raaj Anad Samar||
translation: The mighty forces alongwith Angad are being seen,

gurmukhi: ਜੈ ਸੱਦ ਨਿਨੱਦ ਬਿਹੱਦ ਹੂਅ ਧਨੁ ਜੰਪਤ ਸੁਰ ਪੁਰ ਅਮਰ ॥੩੭੨॥
transliteration: Jai Sadd Ninadd Bihadd Hooa Dhan(u) Janpat Sur Pur Amar||372||
translation: And the hails of victory began to resound in the sky.372.

gurmukhi: ੲਿਤ ਅੰਗਦ ਯੁਵਰਾਜ ਦੁਤੀਅ ਦਿਸ ਬੀਰ ਅਕੰਪਨ ॥
transliteration: It Anad Juvraaj Douteea Dis Beer Akanpan||
translation: On this side the crown prince Angad and on that side the mighty Akampan,

gurmukhi: ਕਰਤ ਬ੍ਰਿਸਟ ਸਰ ਧਾਰ ਤਜਤ ਨਹੀ ਨੈਕ ਅਯੋਧਨ ॥
transliteration: Karat Brist Sar Dhaar Tajat Nahinaik Ayodhan||
translation: Are not feeling tired of showering their arrows.

gurmukhi: ਹੱਥ ਬੱਥ ਮਿਲ ਗੲੀ ਲੁੱਥ ਬਿੱਥਰੀ ਅਹਾੜੰ ॥
translation: The hands are meeting hands and the corpses are lying scattered,

gurmukhi: ਘੁੱਮੇ ਘਾੲਿ ਅਘਾੲਿ ਬੀਰ ਬੰਕੜੇ ਬਬਾੜੰ ॥
transliteration: Ghoumme Ghaae Aghaae Beer Bankade Babaadan||
translation: The brave fighters are roaming and killing one another after challenging them.

gurmukhi: ਪਿੱਖਤ ਬੈਠ ਬਿਬਾਣ ਬਰ ਧੰਨ ਧੰਨ ਜੰਪਤ ਅਮਰ ॥
transliteration: Pikkhat Baith Bibaan Bar Dhatn Dhatn Janpat Amar||
translation: The gods are hailing them while sitting in their air-vehicles.

gurmukhi: ਭਵ ਭੂਤ ਭਵਿੱਖਯ ਭਵਾਨ ਮੋ ਅਬ ਲਗ ਲਖਯੋ ਨ ਅਸ ਸਮਰ ॥੩੭੩॥
transliteration: Bhav Bhoot Bhavikkhya Bhavaan Mo Ab Lag Lakhyo Na As Samara||373||
translation: They are saying that they have never seen such-like horrible war earlier.373.

gurmukhi: ਕਹੂੰ ਮੁੰਡ ਪਿਖੀਅਹ ਕਹੂੰ ਭਕ ਰੁੰਡ ਪਰੇ ਧਰ ॥
transliteration: Kahoon Mounnd Pkheeah Kahoon Bhak Round Dare Dhar||
translation: Somewhere the heads are being seen and somewhere the headless trunks are visible;

gurmukhi: ਕਿਤਹੀ ਜਾਂਘ ਤਰਫੰਤ ਕਹੂੰ ੳੁਛਰੰਤ ਸੁ ਛਬ ਕਰ ॥
transliteration: Keet-hijaanh Tarphant Kahoon Ouchhrant Su Chhab Kar||
translation: Somewhere the legs are writhing and jumping;

gurmukhi: ਭਰਤ ਪੱਤ੍ਰ ਖੇਚਰੰ ਕਹੂੰ ਚਾਵੰਡ ਚਿਕਾਰੈਂ ॥
transliteration: Bharat Pattra Khecharan Kahoon Chaavand Chikdarain||
translation: Somewhere the vampires are filling their vessels with blood;

gurmukhi: ਕਿਲਕਤ ਕਤਹ ਮਸਾਨ ਕਹੂੰ ਭੈਰਵ ਭਭਕਾਰੈਂ ॥
transliteration: Kilkat Katah Masaan Kahoon Bhairav Bhabhkdarain||
translation: Somewhere the shrieks of vultures are being heard;
